intro: Amblyorhinum spicatum, commonly known as the spiny hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Amblyorhinum spicatum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in native plant landscaping.
